snippet: Some conservatives want to alter the fundamental power structure of the House by reducing the power of the speaker in favor of greater authority for the rank and file.
abstract: House Republicans in group Freedom Caucus look to weaken role of House Speaker after working to oust Rep John Boehner; move, which would reverse decades-long trend of centralizing leadership, aims to empower rank-and-file congress members; questionnaire given to House Speaker candidates outlines their proposals.

byline.original: By CARL HULSE and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

lead_paragraph: Some conservatives want to alter the fundamental power structure of the House by reducing the power of the speaker in favor of greater authority for the rank and file.

headline.main: After Boehner, House Hard-Liners Aim to Weaken Speaker’s Clout
headline.print_headline: After Boehner, House Hard-Liners Aim to Weaken Speakership Itself
